headline: Mag 7 vs. 'S&P 493': Earnings to show shifting narrative
summary: It's a busy earnings week, as companies with a combined $20 trillion in market capitalization are set to report. JPMorgan Asset Management global market strategist Jack Manley joins Morning Brief with Brad Smith and Madison Mills to discuss upcoming earnings, including from some "Magnificent Seven" names, and take a closer look at Mag Seven performance compared to the other 493 companies of the S&P 500 (^GSPC). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Mag 7 earnings, April jobs, Trump's first 100 days: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are moving higher to kick off what is dubbed the "busiest earnings week" for the S&P 500 (^GSPC) as Meta Platforms (META), Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), and Amazon (AMZN) prepare to release their quarterly results. The economic data expected out this week includes April's jobs report and March Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index. Lastly, the S&P 500 has reportedly fallen less than 8% in the first 100 days of President Trump's second administration. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: 5 Key Lessons I've Learned From 7 Years of Stock Market Sell-Offs
summary: Investors have been on such a turbulent roller coaster that it's easy to forget that the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) was up slightly through the first two months of the year.  With April coming to a close and the major indexes firmly in the red, investors may be wondering how long volatility will last, and if now is a good time to buy stocks or run for the exits.  Here are five lessons I've learned from major sell-offs over the last seven years, and how these lessons can help you navigate market uncertainty.

raw.headline: 5 Key Lessons I've Learned From 7 Years of Stock Market Sell-Offs

With April coming to a close and the major indexes firmly in the red, investors may be wondering how long volatility will last, and if now is a good time to buy stocks or run for the exits.  Here are five lessons I've learned from major sell-offs over the last seven years, and how these lessons can help you navigate market uncertainty.
